document_data.mainbody: 'Satama''' was a trader and later the founder of the cult of the [[Adama]].
document_data.History:
At some point around {{Yearlink|-256}}, the [[Durpari]] [[merchant]], Satama had an epiphany and developed the philosophical and spiritual concept that everything in the [[Toril]] was interconnected, including the [[deities]], making everything part of one singular, all-encompassing entity, simply known as "The One" or "Adama" in the [[Durpari language|language of the durpari]].<ref>

After developing his teachings, Satama began preaching his philosophy, quickly establishing a fast-growing cult in Durpar.

In {{Yearlink|-252}}, the influence of the Adama became so great in Durpar that Satama was named Maharajah of the nation, becoming the new head of state.
document_data.Quotes:
{{Quote|''Here the Adama has touched. We will abide here. All is part of the one, but this is the best part.''|In relation to the [[Shining Lands]].}}
{{Quote|''All gods are but part of the Adama. Do you hate your wife because she is a woman and you are a man? Hate not then those who worship a different aspect of the Adama.''|When describing the [[Adama]]'s stance on [[deities]].}}
